total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern of the number 3 and 8 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the relationship between the number 3 and 8 in the input grid and the output grid.
Q3: Identify the transformation rules from the input grid to the output grid.
Q4: Apply the transformation rules to the quiz input grid to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern of the number 3 and 8 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the relationship between the number 3 and 8 in the input grid and the output grid.
Q3: Identify the transformation rules from the input grid to the output grid.
Q4: Apply the transformation rules to the quiz input grid to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern of the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a smaller section of the input grid. Identify the coordinates of the top left and bottom right corners of this section in the input grid.
Q3: Notice that the output grid only contains the numbers 3 and 8. Identify the rule for which numbers from the input grid are included in the output grid.
Q4: Notice that the output grid is a rectangle. Identify the rule for the shape of the output grid.
Q5: Apply the rules identified in Q2, Q3, and Q4 to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
select_new_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern of the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a smaller section of the input grid. Identify the coordinates of the top left and bottom right corners of this section in the input grid.
Q3: Notice that the output grid only contains the numbers 3 and 8. Identify the rule for which numbers from the input grid are included in the output grid.
Q4: Notice that the output grid is a rectangle. Identify the rule for the shape of the output grid.
Q5: Apply the rules identified in Q2, Q3, and Q4 to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.
